channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter and fly tipping, 25th September
item.description:
Absolutely awful litter, bin debris and fly tipping. This is a typical sight at this location.

item.title: Gutter weeds, 25th September
item.description:
The weeds were attempted to be cleared but only half was completed, as the photos show the weeds are still prevalent along the gutter which will still stop the rain water from running freely, causing flooding in my garage. This still needs addressing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Poverest Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights are constantly changing to red every few minutes blocking the roundabout, 25th September
item.description:
The pedestrian lights next to the yellow self storage and football place, are changing themselves to red every few seconds after changing to green, no one is crossing, but are constantly changing to red for less than a minute after being green, which is causing gridlock on the already very busy Clifftons Roundabout, and could easily cause an accident as traffic tries to push it way through. Location: A20 Sidcup Road, just after the Junction of Eltham Palace Road. Travelling towards Mottingham. The lights on the other carriageway seem to be working alright.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist graffiti, 25th September
item.description:
This has been ongoing since 13th September. Some flags were painted over but then they reappeared. Action needs to be taken

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney Council need to address this issue of people parking their vehicles in between garages causing an obstruction to least rented garages. I could not get my car out my garage due to this car being parked illegally. Driver nowhere to be seen for hours. Hackney Council need to put bollards or gates in place and give Leaseholders keys to prevent this anti-social behavior and illegal parking and nuisance. Hackney Council ok to take rent for garages but not addressing that illegal parking and nuisance being caused., 25th September
item.description:
Vehicle obstructing Leaseholders garage regular occurrence.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merriam Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned commercial vehicle, 25th September
item.description:
Ford transit has not moved for seven weeks.The transit is not parked in the same direction as the traffic which is against the law. Additionally, a vehicle of this size and weight should display parking lights front and back when left overnight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hilldrop Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles hanging from tree on footpath by metal bridge, 25th September
item.description:
There are three really long brambles hanging down from a tree when you walk from the black metal bridge through to the ornamental gardens and the river which catch you in the face and so need cutting down please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Riverside Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
